sync.add-page.add-labels.description: Add labels to all the resources retrieved from this connector.
sync.add-page.add-labels.title: Add labels
sync.add-page.confirm-authenticate.descr: By clicking on “Continue” you’ll access the third-party website to complete the authentication process. Upon completion, you will be redirected to the folders selection.
sync.add-page.confirm-authenticate.title: Authenticate with {{connector}}
sync.add-page.connector-name.description: You’ll be able to find the connector in the Synchronize list.
sync.add-page.connector-name.title: Name your connector
sync.add-page.description.confluence: Upload and synchronize content from selected Confluence folders.
sync.add-page.description.dropbox: Upload and synchronize content from selected Dropbox folders.
sync.add-page.description.folder: Upload and synchronize content from your desktop folders.
sync.add-page.description.gdrive: Upload and synchronize content from selected Google Drive folders.
sync.add-page.description.onedrive: Upload and synchronize content from selected Onedrive folders.
sync.add-page.description.rss: Upload and synchronize content from a RSS source.
sync.add-page.description.sharepoint: Upload and synchronize content from selected Sharepoint folders.
sync.add-page.description.sitemap: Upload and synchronize web pages content from a sitemap.
sync.add-page.filter-resources.descripti: We will only sync the resources matching the selection.
sync.add-page.filter-resources.file-exte: Separate with commas the file extensions you want to include or exclude.
sync.add-page.filter-resources.title: Filter the resources
sync.add-page.security-group.description: Nuclia resources will store the security group names in a specific attribute. This feature is useful if you want to build your own security proxy on top of Nuclia using the API to filter this attribute.
sync.add-page.security-group.title: Synchronize the security groups
sync.add-page.title: Create new {{connector}} connector
sync.add-page.toast.generic-error: An error occurred while saving your connector
sync.confirm.cancel-oauth.description: By canceling now, your configuration and authentication process will be lost.
sync.confirm.cancel-oauth.title: Cancel the creation of the connector?
sync.confirm.deletion.description: This action cannot be undone. Deleting will stop the synchronization of new files from this source, but existing resources already in your Knowledge Box won’t be affected.
sync.confirm.deletion.title: Delete {{title}}
sync.connectors.common.cookies.help: To allow Nuclia processing to by-pass paywalls, authentication, or any unwanted display that would block the access to the actual page content.
sync.connectors.common.cookies.label: Cookies
sync.connectors.common.css.help: Will restrict the indexation to the text content corresponding to this CSS selector.
sync.connectors.common.css.label: CSS selector
sync.connectors.common.headers.help: To allow Nuclia processing to by-pass paywalls, authentication, or any unwanted display that would block the access to the actual page content.
sync.connectors.common.headers.label: HTTP headers
sync.connectors.common.local-extract.hel: Will load the web page locally and send the content to Nuclia. It requires to install @nuclia/extractor, see the documentation.
sync.connectors.common.localstorage.help: To allow Nuclia processing to by-pass paywalls, authentication, or any unwanted display that would block the access to the actual page content.
sync.connectors.common.restrict-indexati: Will restrict the indexation to the text content corresponding to this CSS selector or XPath selector. The XPath selector takes precedence over the CSS selector.
sync.connectors.common.web-scraping-help: Allow Nuclia to bypass paywalls, authentication, or any unwanted display that would block or pollute the access to the actual page content.
sync.connectors.common.xpath.help: Will restrict the indexation to the text content corresponding to this XPath selector. If defined, it takes precedence over the CSS selector.
sync.connectors.common.xpath.label: XPath selector
sync.connectors.confluence.account.descr: Add your account information, you’ll be able to see API tokens from Confluence’s security settings.
sync.connectors.confluence.account.title: Confluence account
sync.connectors.confluence.token.label: API token
sync.connectors.confluence.url.label: Confluence site URL
sync.connectors.confluence.user.label: User account
sync.connectors.folder.local-path.descri: Write the local path to the folder you want to sync, you’ll be able to select subfolders in the following step.
sync.connectors.folder.local-path.title: Local folder path
sync.connectors.rss.url.label: RSS feed URL
sync.connectors.sharepoint.account.title: Sharepoint account
sync.connectors.sharepoint.site.label: Site name
sync.connectors.sitemap.url.label: Sitemap URL
sync.details.activity-log.description: All syncs are triggered automatically every 60 minutes.
sync.details.activity-log.title: Sync’s activity logs
sync.details.modal.description: You can either synchronize only the changes (creations, modifications, deletions) since the last synchronization, or resynchronize all the data from the beginning.
sync.details.modal.title: What data do you want to sync?
sync.details.settings.name: Name
sync.details.settings.title: Connector settings
sync.folder-selection.empty-message: You didn't select any folder yet
sync.home-page.add-sources.description: Automatically push content from local sources to your Knowledge Box
sync.home-page.add-sources.title: Add sources
sync.home-page.description: Upload and synchronize content from local sources.
sync.home-page.setup-server.description: The Nuclia Sync Agent is an application that allows you to synchronize files or links in your Knowledge Box.
sync.home-page.setup-server.on-desktop.r: To install the sync server locally, download the latest version for your system.
Use the Nuclia Sync Agent on your desktop
sync.home-page.setup-server.on-server.ra: To deploy it manually on a server, follow these instructions.
sync.home-page.setup-server.title: Set up a sync server
sync.home-page.sync-list.description: You can manage here your different sources, your sync agent must be active.
sync.home-page.sync-list.title: Synchronizations
